column1: Narcotics are strong drugs that are sometimes used to treat pain.
Narcotics work by attaching themselves to pain receptors in your brain.
Even though narcotics can block the pain, they cannot cure the cause of your pain.
- Hydrocodone (Vicodin) - Hydromorphone (Dilaudid) - Meperidine (Demerol) - Morphine (MS Contin) - Oxycodone (Oxycontin, Percocet, Percodan) - Tramadol (Ultram)
There are many other interventions of medications and treatments with good results for long term back pain.
How you take narcotics will depend on your pain.
- When your pain begins to lessen, talk with the provider you see for pain about switching to another kind of pain reliever.
